etl.comment#01: # PreETL Actions configuration. Use it to perform any set of queries in DCPAM Database before ETL
etl.comment#02: # process is started (ie. to clear the Staging Area).

extract.comment#01: # Sample config below for inserted records works as "SELECT id FROM secondary_db WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT id FROM primary_db)".
extract.comment#02: # Another example is "SELECT id FROM secondary_db WHERE created > SELECT MAX(chaned) FROM primary_db" for deleted records.
extract.comment#03: # In Extract subprocess, only one field name (column) is allowed in "SELECT ... FROM primary_db" query.
extract.comment#04: # In Extract subprocess, query may finish with 0, 1 or many result rows.
extract.comment#05: # The "%%s" format specifier is used by DCPAM to insert results from primary_db query into secondary_db query SQL.
extract.comment#06: # Only SELECT queries are allowed in "*_sql" commands.

inserted.primary_db_sql: SELECT system_worklog_id FROM accounted_time WHERE system = 'OTRS'
inserted.secondary_db_sql: SELECT t.id AS system_object_id, ta.id AS system_worklog_id, t.customer_id AS system_customer, ta.create_by AS system_agent_id, ta.time_unit AS system_accounted_time, ta.create_time AS system_created FROM time_accounting ta LEFT JOIN ticket t ON t.id = ta.ticket_id WHERE ta.id NOT IN (%s)

deleted.primary_db_sql: SELECT id AS system_worklog_id FROM time_accounting
deleted.secondary_db_sql: SELECT system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created, system FROM accounted_time WHERE is_valid = 1 AND system_worklog_id NOT IN (%s)

modified.primary_db_sql: SELECT MAX(changed) AS changed FROM accounted_time WHERE is_valid = 1 AND SYSTEM = 'OTRS'
modified.secondary_db_sql: SELECT t.id AS system_object_id, ta.id AS system_worklog_id, t.customer_id AS system_customer, ta.create_by AS system_agent_id, ta.time_unit AS system_accounted_time, ta.create_time AS system_created FROM time_accounting ta LEFT JOIN ticket t ON t.id = ta.ticket_id WHERE ta.change_time > '%s'

etl.comment#05: # Staging Area configuration - a temporary tables, where extracted data is stored and ready to Transform process.
etl.comment#06: # According to the documentation, inserted, deleted and modified records coexist here at the same time, so additional column "e_type" is used:
etl.comment#10: # There is no restriction on the query type in "sql" commands.

inserted.sql: INSERT INTO stage_accounted_time (system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created, is_valid, system, e_type) VALUES (?, ?, '?', '?', ?, '?', 1, 'OTRS', 1)

modified.sql: INSERT INTO stage_accounted_time (system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created, is_valid, system, e_type) VALUES (?, ?, '?', '?', ?, '?', 1, 'OTRS', 3)

transform.comment#01: # Transform subprocess configuration. DCPAM calls external modules to perform data transformation.
transform.comment#02: # Transform modules can be placed both on the local machine and remote servers. The latter approach
transform.comment#03: # is recommended to handle compute-intensive transformations.
transform.comment#04: # When transform module is local script or application, standard system path must be specified.
transform.comment#05: # When transform module is placed on the remote server, dcpam:// URL must be specified. It is
transform.comment#06: # required then to run DCPAM EXEC daemon on the remote server.
transform.comment#07: # DCPAM calls external modules with additional, required params:
transform.comment#13: # - OR tconn: DCPAM database connection string (auto)
transform.comment#19: # - OR sconn: original source connection string (auto)
transform.comment#20: # - sql: query used by transform module to fetch data for transformation (specified here)
transform.comment#21: # No other data is exchanged between DCPAM and transform module invoker (DCPAM EXEC). Transform
transform.comment#22: # module is responsible for all data updates in the Staging Area and source system (optionally).
transform.comment#23: # Transform modules must be executable files.
transform.comment#24: # Running Transform subprocess is optional in DCPAM.

load.comment#01: # Query executed with "output_data_sql" is fed by the records fetched with "input_data_sql" from Staging Area or
load.comment#02: # "output_data_sql" is used directly by Extract subprocess when Staging Area is disabled.
load.comment#03: # These are records extracted and transformed in previous steps.
load.comment#04: # It is possible to decide on which columns are to be loaded or updated.
load.comment#05: # There is no restriction on the query type in "*_sql" commands.

inserted.input_data_sql: SELECT system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created FROM stage_accounted_time WHERE e_type = 1
inserted.output_data_sql: INSERT INTO accounted_time (system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created, is_valid, system) VALUES (?, ?, '?', '?', ?, '?', 1, 'OTRS')

deleted.input_data_sql: SELECT system_worklog_id FROM stage_accounted_time WHERE e_type = 2
deleted.output_data_sql: UPDATE accounted_time SET is_valid = 0 WHERE system_worklog_id = '?'

modified.input_data_sql: SELECT system_object_id, system_worklog_id, system_customer, system_agent_id, system_accounted_time, system_created, is_valid FROM stage_accounted_time WHERE e_type = 3
modified.output_data_sql: UPDATE accounted_time SET system_object_id = ?, system_worklog_id = ?, system_customer = '?', system_agent_id = '?', system_accounted_time = ?, system_created = '?', is_valid = ? WHERE system_worklog_id = ?

app.run_once_comment#01: # Set this param with "true" value to run DCPAM in "On Schedule" mode (ie. with CRON).
app.run_once_comment#02: # Remove this param or set with "false" value to run DCPAM in "Persistent" mode (daemon-like).
